summary: This document is an invoice from FedEx addressed to Jeffrey E. Epstein for shipping services rendered. It details transportation charges, discounts, and specific shipments made by Epstein, including dates and recipients. The invoice highlights the total amount due and provides a summary of the services provided.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the primary account holder for the FedEx services detailed in the invoice, with multiple shipments listed.

persons.name: Eric
persons.context: Eric is mentioned as a reference for one of the shipments sent by Epstein.

persons.name: Jeanne Brennan
persons.context: Jeanne Brennan is listed as a recipient for one of the shipments sent by Epstein.

persons.name: Stuart Craig
persons.context: Stuart Craig is mentioned as a sender for one of the shipments associated with Epstein.

connections.description: Epstein sent a shipment to Jeanne Brennan as indicated in the invoice.
Stuart Craig is noted as a sender for a shipment associated with Epstein.
Eric is referenced in connection with one of Epstein's shipments.

events.title: Shipment Pickup
events.description: Multiple shipments were picked up by FedEx for delivery, including those addressed to various recipients.

events.title: Shipment Delivery
events.description: A shipment sent by Epstein was delivered to a recipient in Paris.

events.title: Shipment Delivery
events.description: Another shipment sent by Epstein was delivered to a financial trust company.

keyFacts: The invoice is dated October 11, 2004, and details charges for FedEx services provided to Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Total charges for the invoice amount to USD 232.55.
Multiple shipments were made by Epstein, including deliveries to locations in Paris and St. Thomas.
The invoice includes specific references to discounts applied to the shipping charges.
There are several references to individuals associated with Epstein in the context of shipping and receiving packages.
